issue.title: Migrating to nx@17.0.1 generates `Error: Unable to resolve @nrwl/linter:eslint.` when linting
issue.body:
### Current Behavior

Running `nx lint` on a project after migrating from `nx@16.10.0` to `nx@17.0.` generates `Error: Unable to resolve @nrwl/linter:eslint.`

### Expected Behavior

Linting should work as before.

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

```
nx migrate latest
npm install
npx nx migrate --run-migrations 
nx lint project-name
```

### Nx Report

```shell
Under `nx@16.10.01`:


 >  NX   Report complete - copy this into the issue template

   Node   : 18.16.1
   OS     : darwin-arm64
   npm    : 9.5.1
   
   nx             : 16.10.0
   @nx/js         : 16.10.0
   @nx/jest       : 16.10.0
   @nx/linter     : 16.10.0
   @nx/workspace  : 16.10.0
   @nx/angular    : 16.10.0
   @nx/cypress    : 16.10.0
   @nx/devkit     : 16.5.1
   @nx/node       : 16.10.0
   @nrwl/tao      : 16.10.0
   @nx/webpack    : 16.10.0
   nx-cloud       : 16.5.2
   typescript     : 5.1.6
   ---------------------------------------
   Community plugins:
   apollo-angular : 5.0.2
   ---------------------------------------
   The following packages should match the installed version of nx
     - @nx/devkit@16.5.1
     - @nrwl/devkit@16.5.1
   
   To fix this, run `nx migrate nx@16.10.0`



After `nx migrate latest` `npx nx migrate --run-migrations`:



>  NX   Report complete - copy this into the issue template

   Node   : 18.16.1
   OS     : darwin-arm64
   npm    : 9.5.1
   
   nx             : 17.0.1
   @nx/js         : 17.0.1
   @nx/jest       : 17.0.1
   @nx/linter     : 17.0.1
   @nx/eslint     : 17.0.1
   @nx/workspace  : 17.0.1
   @nx/angular    : 17.0.1
   @nx/cypress    : 17.0.1
   @nx/devkit     : 16.5.1
   @nx/node       : 17.0.1
   @nrwl/tao      : 17.0.1
   @nx/web        : 17.0.1
   @nx/webpack    : 17.0.1
   typescript     : 5.1.6
   ---------------------------------------
   Community plugins:
   apollo-angular : 5.0.2
   ---------------------------------------
   The following packages should match the installed version of nx
     - @nx/devkit@16.5.1
     - @nrwl/devkit@16.5.1
   
   To fix this, run `nx migrate nx@17.0.1`
```


### Failure Logs

```shell
>  NX   Unable to resolve @nrwl/linter:eslint.

   Cannot find module '@nrwl/linter/package.json'
   Require stack:
   - /path/to/node_modules/nx/src/utils/package-json.js
   - /path/to/node_modules/nx/src/utils/package-manager.js
   - /path/to/node_modules/nx/bin/init-local.js
   - /path/to/node_modules/nx/bin/nx.js

Error: Unable to resolve @nrwl/linter:eslint.
Cannot find module '@nrwl/linter/package.json'
```


### Package Manager Version

_No response_

### Operating System

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Other (Please specify)

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
Hey there,

i have the same problem. For me the command `nx lint my-lib` works, but not the affected command (`nx affected:lint`).
I guess I could also fix it manually like Keith but I think this is not the real solution here.

issue.title: NX Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64' on Mac M1 chip
issue.body:
### Current Behavior

Got error during commit.
NX Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64' on Mac M1 chip

Started after update from nx 15.9.4

### Expected Behavior

Commit should work

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Deleted node modules
2. Cleared npm cache
3. Deleted package-lock.json
4. npm i
5. Try to do commit

### Nx Report

```shell
Report complete - copy this into the issue template

   Node   : 18.18.2
   OS     : darwin-arm64
   npm    : 9.8.1
   
   nx                 : 16.10.0
   @nx/js             : 16.10.0
   @nx/jest           : 16.10.0
   @nx/linter         : 16.10.0
   @nx/workspace      : 16.10.0
   @nx/angular        : 16.10.0
   @nx/cypress        : 16.10.0
   @nx/devkit         : 16.10.0
   @nx/eslint-plugin  : 16.10.0
   @nx/nest           : 16.10.0
   @nx/node           : 16.10.0
   @nx/storybook      : 16.10.0
   @nrwl/tao          : 16.10.0
   @nx/webpack        : 16.10.0
   typescript         : 5.1.6
   ---------------------------------------
   Community plugins:
   @ionic/angular     : 6.7.2
   @storybook/angular : 7.5.1
```


### Failure Logs

```shell
husky > pre-commit (node v18.18.2)
Creating/updating nx project graph...
 >  NX   Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64'
   Require stack:
 node_modules/nx/src/native/index.js
 node_modules/nx/src/utils/workspace-context.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/utils/retrieve-workspace-files.js
 node_modules/nx/src/config/workspaces.js
 node_modules/nx/src/utils/nx-plugin.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/build-project-graph.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/project-graph.js
husky > pre-commit hook failed (add --no-verify to bypass)
```


### Package Manager Version

_No response_

### Operating System

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Other (Please specify)

### Additional Information

_No response_

commits.message:
feat(release): add 'git-tag' currentVersionResolver and conventional commits support (#19267)

Co-authored-by: James Henry <james@henry.sc>
cleanup(misc): make nx console links on various starter pages consistent (#19867)

fix(js): add missing entry to migrations.json (#19869)

Co-authored-by: Sonika Sharma <sonikasharma@csod.com>
fix(core): package json configuration should never override project.json in generators (#19874)
fix(js): should respect vitest test environment (#19859)
fix(js): fix typescript analysis for imports in objects in arrays (#19862)

fix(js): add @babel/plugin-transform-class-properties to babel preset (#19818)

Co-authored-by: Jack Hsu <jack.hsu@gmail.com>
feat(js): skipPackageJson in js lib generator (#19821)
fix(react): Update types version so that there is no mismatch when using yarn (#19882)
fix(nx-dev): mobile menu, adding ai chat and changelog (#19887)
feat(angular): drop support for angular v14 (#19711)
feat(angular): switch generation defaults to use standalone by default (#19849)

issue.title: nx migrate fails with nx command not found
issue.body:
### Current Behavior

I have 2 separate NX monorepos. In one, I've managed to execute the `nx migrate latest` without any issue (and so did my colleague), however, in the other, I can use the `nx` commands, e.g `nx serve...`, but I cannot run the migrate script.

When I run `nx --version`, it shows:
```ts
Nx Version:
- Local: v16.10.0
- Global: Not found
```

I am using Volta for managing nodejs.

### Expected Behavior

The migrate should recognize the `nx`  command.

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

I am not sure what causes this, so I cannot reproduce it.

### Nx Report

```shell
Node   : 18.15.0
   OS     : linux-x64
   yarn   : 3.6.4
   
   nx                 : 16.10.0
   @nx/js             : 16.10.0
   @nx/jest           : 16.10.0
   @nx/linter         : 16.10.0
   @nx/workspace      : 16.10.0
   @nx/cypress        : 16.10.0
   @nx/devkit         : 16.10.0
   @nx/eslint-plugin  : 16.10.0
   @nx/react          : 16.10.0
   @nrwl/tao          : 16.10.0
   @nx/vite           : 16.10.0
   @nx/web            : 16.10.0
   @nx/webpack        : 16.10.0
   typescript         : 5.1.6
```


### Failure Logs

```shell
nx migrate latest           
/bin/sh: 1: /tmp/tmp-68810-2OwFrgKzD8Mg/node_modules/.bin/nx: not found
Command failed: /tmp/tmp-68810-2OwFrgKzD8Mg/node_modules/.bin/nx _migrate latest

These paths get generated, and they contain the `package.json` and `yarn.lock` files.
```


### Package Manager Version

yarn: 3.6.4

### Operating System

- [ ] macOS
- [X] Linux
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Other (Please specify)

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: fix(angular): support scoped remote names for federation
issue.body:
<!-- Please make sure you have read the submission guidelines before posting an PR -->
<!-- https://github.com/nrwl/nx/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-a-pr -->

<!-- Please make sure that your commit message follows our format -->
<!-- Example: `fix(nx): must begin with lowercase` -->

## Current Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we have today -->
We currently error if someone tries to use a remote name such as '@scope/remote'

## Expected Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we should expect with the changes in this PR -->
We should not error if someone tries to use a remote name with this

## Related Issue(s)
<!-- Please link the issue being fixed so it gets closed when this is merged. -->

Fixes #

issue.title: Host app fails to serve remote application when we execute nx serve host

labels.name: scope: angular
labels.description: Issues related to Angular support in Nx

comment.body:
@Coly010  - https://github.com/sonikasharma1403/NX-module-federation

Command to start the host: `npx nx serve shell`
Steps followed:
1. use the old version of NX (v15 used in the repo) and create a host, remote application. Use the out of the box code to start the shell. notice that when we serve the shell, it starts all the remotes.
2. Migrate to the latest NX and notice that the OOB setup no longer works.

As mentioned, with v15, the list of remotes in the shell's `module-federation.config.js` is empty and it used to start the remote server

issue.title: fix(angular): extract remotes from manifest correctly
issue.body:
<!-- Please make sure you have read the submission guidelines before posting an PR -->
<!-- https://github.com/nrwl/nx/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-a-pr -->

<!-- Please make sure that your commit message follows our format -->
<!-- Example: `fix(nx): must begin with lowercase` -->

## Current Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we have today -->
When extracting remotes from manifest, we use Object.keys, which returns the array. However, we push this full array into another array, instead of spreading it.

## Expected Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we should expect with the changes in this PR -->
Spread the Object.keys array to add each remote extracted individually

## Related Issue(s)
<!-- Please link the issue being fixed so it gets closed when this is merged. -->

Fixes #

How can I do this case?

pull_request.title: fix(angular): extract remotes from manifest correctly
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please make sure you have read the submission guidelines before posting an PR -->
<!-- https://github.com/nrwl/nx/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-a-pr -->

<!-- Please make sure that your commit message follows our format -->
<!-- Example: `fix(nx): must begin with lowercase` -->

## Current Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we have today -->
When extracting remotes from manifest, we use Object.keys, which returns the array. However, we push this full array into another array, instead of spreading it.

## Expected Behavior
<!-- This is the behavior we should expect with the changes in this PR -->
Spread the Object.keys array to add each remote extracted individually

## Related Issue(s)
<!-- Please link the issue being fixed so it gets closed when this is merged. -->

Fixes #

issue.title: Host app fails to serve remote apps for dynamic module federation in angular
issue.body:
### Current Behavior

Running `yarn nx serve shell --devRemotes=app1,app2` in the terminal produces this output below
> nx run shell:serve:development --devRemotes=app1,app2
>  NX  Starting module federation dev-server for shell with 0 remotes


### Expected Behavior

In the past version of nx@16.10.0, this will run the host(shell) together with 2 remotes(app1, app2)

### GitHub Repo

https://github.com/kenLovesToCode/test-for-bug-nx-angular-monorepo-dynamic-federation

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run `npx create-nx-workspace sample --packageManager=yarn`
Need to install the following packages:
  create-nx-workspace@17.0.2
Ok to proceed? (y) y

 >  NX   Let's create a new workspace [https://nx.dev/getting-started/intro]

√ Which stack do you want to use? · angular
√ Integrated monorepo, or standalone project? · integrated
√ Application name · tester
√ Default stylesheet format · scss
√ Test runner to use for end to end (E2E) tests · cypress
√ Would you like to use Standalone Components in your application? · No
√ Would you like to add routing? · Yes
√ Enable distributed caching to make your CI faster · Yes

 >  NX   Creating your v17.0.2 workspace.
 
 2. Run `yarn nx g @nx/angular:host shell --remotes=app1,app2 --dynamic`
√ Which stylesheet format would you like to use? · scss
√ Which E2E test runner would you like to use? · cypress
√ What should be the project name and where should it be generated? · shell @ apps/shell



### Nx Report

```shell
Node   : 18.14.1
   OS     : win32-x64
   yarn   : 1.22.19

   nx                 : 17.0.2
   @nx/js             : 17.0.2
   @nx/jest           : 17.0.2
   @nx/linter         : 17.0.2
   @nx/eslint         : 17.0.2
   @nx/workspace      : 17.0.2
   @nx/angular        : 17.0.2
   @nx/cypress        : 17.0.2
   @nx/devkit         : 17.0.2
   @nx/eslint-plugin  : 17.0.2
   @nrwl/tao          : 17.0.2
   @nx/web            : 17.0.2
   @nx/webpack        : 17.0.2
   typescript         : 5.1.6
```


### Failure Logs

_No response_

### Package Manager Version

_No response_

### Operating System

- [ ] macOS
- [ ] Linux
- [X] Windows
- [ ] Other (Please specify)

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
also https://nx.dev/recipes/troubleshooting/troubleshoot-nx-install-issues#supported-native-module-platforms

`Supported native module platforms
We publish modules for the following platforms:

macOS 11+ (arm64, x64)
Windows (arm64, x64)
We use the msvc target, so as long as Microsoft supports your Windows version, it should work on it
Linux (arm64, x64)
We use gnu ang musl targets, which are used by the most popular Linux distributions
FreeBSD (x64)
If you're running a machine that isn't part of the list above, then Nx does not support it at this time. [Please open an issue on GitHub](https://github.com/nrwl/nx/issues/new/choose) if you feel Nx should support that platform and we will assess what can be done, please make sure to include your platform and architecture in the issue.`

issue.title: NX Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64' on Mac M1 chip
issue.body:
### Current Behavior

Got error during commit.
NX Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64' on Mac M1 chip

Started after update from nx 15.9.4

### Expected Behavior

Commit should work

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Deleted node modules
2. Cleared npm cache
3. Deleted package-lock.json
4. npm i
5. Try to do commit

### Nx Report

```shell
Report complete - copy this into the issue template

   Node   : 18.18.2
   OS     : darwin-arm64
   npm    : 9.8.1
   
   nx                 : 16.10.0
   @nx/js             : 16.10.0
   @nx/jest           : 16.10.0
   @nx/linter         : 16.10.0
   @nx/workspace      : 16.10.0
   @nx/angular        : 16.10.0
   @nx/cypress        : 16.10.0
   @nx/devkit         : 16.10.0
   @nx/eslint-plugin  : 16.10.0
   @nx/nest           : 16.10.0
   @nx/node           : 16.10.0
   @nx/storybook      : 16.10.0
   @nrwl/tao          : 16.10.0
   @nx/webpack        : 16.10.0
   typescript         : 5.1.6
   ---------------------------------------
   Community plugins:
   @ionic/angular     : 6.7.2
   @storybook/angular : 7.5.1
```


### Failure Logs

```shell
husky > pre-commit (node v18.18.2)
Creating/updating nx project graph...
 >  NX   Cannot find module '@nx/nx-darwin-x64'
   Require stack:
 node_modules/nx/src/native/index.js
 node_modules/nx/src/utils/workspace-context.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/utils/retrieve-workspace-files.js
 node_modules/nx/src/config/workspaces.js
 node_modules/nx/src/utils/nx-plugin.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/build-project-graph.js
 node_modules/nx/src/project-graph/project-graph.js
husky > pre-commit hook failed (add --no-verify to bypass)
```


### Package Manager Version

_No response_

### Operating System

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Other (Please specify)

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
root reason inside 
`node_modules/nx/src/native/index.js`, 
`const { platform, arch } = process`
macos M2 chip

`node -p 'process.arch'` -> arm64 but inside NX `node_modules/nx/src/native/index.js` we can see platform: darwin, arch: x64 not arm64

issue.title: Official plugin for Svelte and SveltKit
issue.body:
# Official support for Svelte and Sveltekit

### Description
Would love Nrwl to support and deliver an officially supported Svelte plugin.

### Motivation
Svelte is the next best thing after React & Solid.

This would complete the inventory of prominent offically supported frameworks by NX at least the main frameworks out in the wild today.

### Suggested Implementation
- Offical support
- Vite (Svelte and Sveltkit already use vite)
- Vitest or Jest option
- Storybook support
- Tailwind setup automation option
- Cypress or playwrite scaffold option

### Alternate Implementations
- Offical Solildjs support 😆

comment.body: after official support for vite, was expecting official support for svelte, but sadly it didn't arrive! (but vue arrived 🤷 )
